class.name: Word.FillFormat
class.description: Represents the fill formatting for a shape or text.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents the background color for the fill.

examples.description: Set the background color of a shape's fill to light blue

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a shape's fill format to verify the connection to the Word host application and log context information.

properties.name: foregroundColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents the foreground color for the fill.

examples.description: Set the foreground color of a shape's fill to red

properties.name: gradientAngle
properties.description: Specifies the angle of the gradient fill. The valid range of values is from 0 to 359.9.

examples.description: Set a shape's gradient fill angle to 45 degrees to create a diagonal gradient effect.

properties.name: gradientColorType
properties.description: Gets the gradient color type.

examples.description: Check if a shape's fill has a gradient and display the gradient color type (e.g., OneColor, TwoColors, PresetColors).

properties.name: gradientDegree
properties.description: Returns how dark or light a one-color gradient fill is. A value of 0 means that black is mixed in with the shape's foreground color to form the gradient. A value of 1 means that white is mixed in. Values between 0 and 1 mean that a darker or lighter shade of the foreground color is mixed in.

examples.description: Check if a shape has a one-color gradient fill and display how dark or light it is by reading the gradient degree value.

properties.name: gradientStyle
properties.description: Returns the gradient style for the fill.

examples.description: Get the gradient style of a shape's fill and display it to the user

properties.name: gradientVariant
properties.description: Returns the gradient variant for the fill as an integer value from 1 to 4 for most gradient fills.

examples.description: Check if a shape's gradient fill is using the first variant and display the variant number in the console.

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Specifies if the object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible.

examples.description: Hide the fill formatting of a shape to make it transparent

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: Returns a PatternType value that represents the pattern applied to the fill or line.

examples.description: Get the pattern type of a shape's fill and display it, then set the fill to use a diagonal cross pattern.

properties.name: presetGradientType
properties.description: Returns the preset gradient type for the fill.

examples.description: Get the preset gradient type of a shape's fill and display it to the user

properties.name: presetTexture
properties.description: Gets the preset texture.

examples.description: Get the preset texture of a shape's fill format and display it in the console.

properties.name: rotateWithObject
properties.description: Specifies whether the fill rotates with the shape.

examples.description: Configure a shape's fill to rotate along with the shape when it is rotated

properties.name: textureAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the alignment (the origin of the coordinate grid) for the tiling of the texture fill.

examples.description: Set the texture alignment of a shape's fill to center position

properties.name: textureHorizontalScale
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal scaling factor for the texture fill.

examples.description: Set the horizontal scaling factor of a shape's texture fill to 150% to stretch the texture pattern horizontally

properties.name: textureName
properties.description: Returns the name of the custom texture file for the fill.

examples.description: Get the custom texture file name from a shape's fill and display it in the console.

properties.name: textureOffsetX
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal offset of the texture from the origin in points.

examples.description: Set the horizontal texture offset to 25 points for a shape's fill to adjust the texture pattern position

properties.name: textureOffsetY
properties.description: Specifies the vertical offset of the texture.

examples.description: Set the vertical texture offset to 25 pixels for a shape's fill to adjust the texture pattern position

properties.name: textureTile
properties.description: Specifies whether the texture is tiled.

examples.description: Enable texture tiling for a shape's fill format to create a repeating pattern effect

properties.name: textureType
properties.description: Returns the texture type for the fill.

examples.description: Check if a shape's fill uses a texture and display the texture type in the console.

properties.name: textureVerticalScale
properties.description: Specifies the vertical scaling factor for the texture fill as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.

examples.description: Set the vertical scaling factor of a shape's texture fill to 0.5 to compress the texture pattern vertically to half its original height

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Specifies the degree of transparency of the fill for a shape as a value between 0.0 (opaque) and 1.0 (clear).

examples.description: Set a rectangle shape's fill to 50% transparent (semi-transparent blue)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the fill format type.

examples.description: Check the fill type of a shape and display different messages based on whether it has a solid fill, gradient fill, or other fill type.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Get and display the fill color of the first shape in the document by loading its fill format properties.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Set the fill color and transparency of a shape to create a semi-transparent blue background

methods.name: setOneColorGradient
methods.description: Sets the fill to a one-color gradient.

params.name: variant
params.description: The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 to 4.

params.name: degree
params.description: The gradient degree. Can be a value from 0.0 (dark) to 1.0 (light).

params.name: variant
params.description: The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 to 4.

params.name: degree
params.description: The gradient degree. Can be a value from 0.0 (dark) to 1.0 (light).

examples.description: Apply a one-color gradient fill with a horizontal style to the first shape in the document

methods.name: setPatterned
methods.description: Sets the fill to a pattern.

examples.description: Set the fill of the first shape in the document to a diagonal stripe pattern

methods.name: setPresetGradient
methods.description: Sets the fill to a preset gradient. The gradient style. The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 to 4. The preset gradient type.

examples.description: Apply a preset gradient fill with a horizontal style to the first shape in the document

methods.name: setPresetTextured
methods.description: Sets the fill to a preset texture.

examples.description: Apply a preset textured fill (papyrus texture) to the first shape in the document

methods.name: setTwoColorGradient
methods.description: Sets the fill to a two-color gradient.

examples.description: Apply a two-color gradient fill to a shape with a horizontal linear style

methods.name: solid
methods.description: Sets the fill to a uniform color.

examples.description: Set the fill color of the first shape in the document to a solid red color

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.FillFormat object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.FillFormatData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the fill format properties of the first shape in the document as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a shape's fill format object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls while changing its color properties in separate batches.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a shape's fill format, modify its properties, and then untrack it to release memory after the operation is complete.
